What is Reconstructive Surgery?

Reconstructive surgery is a type of plastic surgery in which patients’ intention to do the operation has medical reasons. The main purpose of this procedure is to correct the defects of your body or get treatment for a disease, while the goal in Cosmetic Surgery is to look better which we discussed in another article. Reconstructive surgery is usually covered by your health insurance and includes various operations such as hand or foot surgery, skin cancer removal, burn care in addition to the following treatments:

Dental health

Dental health has a huge impact on your overall well-being and you need to take oral hygiene habits seriously; otherwise, its consequence will be costly and might lead to diseases that put your health in danger. The easiest way to take care of your teeth is to brush and floss them regularly. There are also a number of other treatments such as fillings and implants that can help you deal with oral problems.

Eye care

Errors in your eyes can be diagnosed through an eye exam and the doctor might suggest wearing glasses and contact lenses or having eye surgery. The most important factor in getting the proper eye care treatment is early diagnosis. So, remember to schedule regular appointments with your doctor to make sure there is nothing wrong with your eyes.

Infertility treatment

Infertility treatment can be categorized as a type of reconstructive surgery. In case you’ve been trying to conceive a child, but you couldn’t get a result within 12 months, you’d better make an appointment with a doctor to figure out the cause and get proper infertility treatment such as insemination, using medicines, etc.
